results.title: Cognitive development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: the first 2 1/2 years”.
Cognition involves the acquiring and use of knowledge. From birth, infants must learn how to learn and develop their senses, memory and perception. This episode discusses the stages of cognitive development as well as examining the theories of Piaget, the roles of recognition and receptive memory and the effect of stimulation in developing cognitive skills.

results.title: Language development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: the first 2 1/2 years”.
This episode looks at how young infants acquire language. Chomsky’s theories about innate language competencies are examined as are the theories of operative conditioning and modelling where environment rather than herditary factors are seen to be more influential in the process of language acquisition. Babies use talking movements from birth and the program illustrates the processes whereby “babbling” becomes articulate speech.

results.title: Emotional and social development
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human development: the first 2 1/2 years”.
Discusses Erikson’s eight stages of development looking at the first two stages of trust versus mistrust and autonomy versus shame and doubt as applying to infants. A newborn baby moves through a development process to become a social being. Focuses on critical periods in development such as stranger anxiety, attachment, separation anxiety and preparation-individuation.

results.title: L'age des Vikings
results.brief_description:
Episode 10 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
The Carolingian Empire has crumbled. In Southern Europe, the Sarazins have invaded Sicily, Rome and Provence. In the East, the Magyars make progress toward Lombardia, Venetia and Burgundy. The North is about to experience the full might of the Normans. This episode covers the organization of Viking society as well as their advances in boat building techniques and marine navigation instrumentation.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Le Siecle de Pericles
results.brief_description:
Episode 6 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
In 450 BC, Pericles lays the foundation of a democratic system in Athens. This episode examines the Golden Age of Athens with its flourishing artistic and political life. It also compares it with the model of society developped in neighbouring Sparta. Topics include: theatre, architecture, religion and Socratic philosophy.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Et la Terre Fut ...
results.brief_description:
Episode 1 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
This first episode deals with the formation of the Earth and the apparition of life on Earth with the amphibians and other prehistorical animals. This episode also covers the evolution of primates, the domestication of fire and the development of hunting techniques.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].

results.title: Le Cro-Magnon
results.brief_description:
Episode 3 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
Following the Ice Age, the era of Cro Magnon starts. The tool making technique has made vast progress. Cro-Magnon is an expert at using stones, bones and skins. He also has a strong artistic bent as demonstrated by the production of human-shaped statuettes and rock face paintings. Cro-Magnon takes the leap from hunter to herder, helped in his endeavour by his ability to domesticate dogs.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].
